scenarios.title: Farewell Party
scenarios.scenario: You are planning a farewell party for nice acquaintances before they leave the city.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Hi! Good to see you. So, we need to plan the farewell party for our friends. Do you already have any ideas when we should have it?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Yes, hi! What do you think, next Friday or Saturday? Friday evening would be better, as most people have Saturday off.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: That is a good idea. Friday evening, around 7:00 PM. Where should we celebrate? Maybe in my garden?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Great! In a restaurant, it would be too expensive. How about a barbecue? I can take care of the salads.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: A barbecue is perfect! I'll buy the meat and the drinks – wine, beer, and water. Who will take care of the invitations?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: I will make the invitations and send them by email. And who pays for what?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: I will cover the costs for the meat and the drinks, and you for the salads.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: That is fair! Then we meet on Friday evening. Great that we clarified that!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Perfect! See you then!

phrases.german: What do you think about a barbecue?

phrases.response: I will take care of it.

scenarios.title: City Trip
scenarios.scenario: You want to plan a two-day trip to a German city together.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Hello Anna, we need to plan our city trip to Hamburg. I'm already looking forward to it!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Me too! Which city did we want to go to? Oh yes, Hamburg! When exactly?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: How about we go the first weekend of next month? Saturday and Sunday.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: That suits me well. But how will we get there? Shall we go by train or by car?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: I suggest we take the ICE train. That is faster and more relaxing, and we save the money for the parking garage.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Good idea. We also need accommodation. I found a central hotel that is not too expensive. I can book it.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Perfect! What do we want to visit? I absolutely want to see the Elbphilharmonie (concert hall).

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: That is a must! And in the evening we could eat at a fish restaurant. I will look for the restaurant and you buy the train tickets.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Agreed! Then I'll book the tickets and you the hotel and the restaurant.

phrases.german: I have an idea: We'll take the train.
phrases.response: That is faster and more relaxing.

phrases.german: I absolutely want to see the Elbphilharmonie.
I can take care of the booking.
phrases.response: That is very kind of you.

scenarios.title: Relocation / Moving House
scenarios.scenario: A mutual friend is moving house soon, and you are supposed to organize the help.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Tina, Thomas is moving next week. We need to help him organize everything.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: True! Let's discuss it. First: When exactly is he moving? We need a precise date.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Next Saturday morning. We should start at 9:00 AM. Who all can help? I'll ask Lukas and Sarah too.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Good. I can take care of the means of transport. I'll call a company that rents out a delivery van.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Excellent! And we need moving boxes. I still have a few, but not enough. I will buy new ones.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Perfect. And we need to cater for the helpers. I suggest I make sandwiches and buy coffee.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: That's great, then I'll buy pizza for dinner. I'll write down all the helpers on a list and you reserve the van, okay?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Agreed! Then everything is organized.

phrases.german: We should start on Saturday at 9:00 AM.
What shall we do about the food?

scenarios.title: Summer Party
scenarios.scenario: You and your colleague are planning the annual summer party for the company.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Hello Max, we need to plan the summer party. When is the best time? End of July or beginning of August?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Beginning of August is better, I think. And where can we celebrate? I suggest the park near the office.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: That is a good idea. It is large enough. What shall we do about the food? We need something simple.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: We could order a catering service. They bring food and dishes. I will get some quotes.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Great! And we need music and dancing. I have a good playlist with summer hits. I will take care of the sound system.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Wonderful! I'll organize the food and the tables. Can you send the invitations to all colleagues?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Yes, I'll do that right away. I'll also write a list for the drinks. Do we need anything else?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: No, I think we have discussed the most important things. I'm looking forward to the party!

phrases.german: I suggest we get some quotes.
Can you perhaps send the invitations?
What shall we do for entertainment?

scenarios.title: Bike Tour
scenarios.scenario: You want to go on a day-long bike tour together this weekend.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Lena, the weather is supposed to be great this weekend! Shall we go on our bike tour?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Yes, absolutely! When do we want to start? In the morning, around 10 AM?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: 10 AM is good. But where are we going? I know a beautiful route along the river. That's about 30 kilometers.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: 30 kilometers is good. But we also need to take a break. Is there a restaurant along the way?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: I don't know exactly. We could have a picnic. I'll bring bread and cheese.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: That's better! I'll make fresh juice and bring fruit. And everyone has to check their bikes!

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: That's true! I'll check the tire pressure and you check the brakes. We'll meet at the bridge at 10 AM.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Perfect! See you Saturday then! I'm looking forward to the fresh air.

phrases.german: When do we want to start?
Everyone has to check their bikes!

scenarios.title: Donation Drive
scenarios.scenario: You want to organize a donation drive for children in the neighborhood.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Hello Martin. We want to start a donation drive to help the children in our area. How do we start?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Hello! First, we need to clarify which organization we want to support. Do you know the children's home on Schillerstraße?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Yes, that's a good choice. We should collect non-monetary donations, not clothes, but toys and books.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Good idea. Where can we collect the donations? I have a basement room that we can use.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Great. I'll create flyers and put them up in the supermarkets. And I'll inform the local newspaper.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Excellent! I'll make a list of things we urgently need and organize the drop-off times.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: And we need volunteers to help with sorting. I'll ask my neighbors.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Agreed. I'll make the list, you do the flyers, and we ask for volunteers. I think that's a good plan!

phrases.german: Where can we collect the donations?

scenarios.title: Children's Birthday Party
scenarios.scenario: Your children are friends, and you are planning a joint celebration.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Susi, our children have birthdays soon. Shall we have a joint celebration?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Yes, that will be easier! Who should we invite? Only the children from school or the parents too?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Only the children. I think 15 children are enough. Where shall we celebrate? My house is too small.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: How about we go to the zoo and have a picnic there? Or we rent a room in the sports hall?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: The sports hall is good if the weather is bad. I'll call there and reserve the room.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Very good. What shall we do about the cake and the sweets? I can bake the cake.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Great! I'll take care of the games and the drinks. We also need a small gift from us.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Agreed. I'll bake the cake and you reserve the room. And we'll buy a gift together.

phrases.german: What shall we do about the cake?

scenarios.title: Fitness Routine
scenarios.scenario: You want to start a healthy sports program together.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Hello Alex! We wanted to do more for our health. What do we suggest? Jogging or swimming?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Hello! I think jogging is easier because we don't need a gym membership.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: That's true. How often do we want to train? I can do three times a week.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Three times is good. And when exactly? I can only do evenings after 6:00 PM.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: 6:30 PM? We could jog in the park, that's closer. And who will look for a good training schedule online?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: I can take that over! I'll look for a plan for beginners and write a list of warm-up exercises.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Great. I'll buy us new sports shoes and look for a good running route in the park.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Perfect! Let's start training on Monday evening.

phrases.german: How often do we want to train?
Who will look for a good training schedule?

scenarios.title: Class Reunion
scenarios.scenario: You want to organize a reunion with former schoolmates after 10 years.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Hey, it's been 10 years since we finished school! We need to organize a class reunion!

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Yes, that's a great idea! But that's a lot of work. Who are we inviting? Only our class or the teachers too?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Only the students from the class. When is the best time? Maybe in autumn? End of October?

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: October is good. And where shall we meet? In the old school building? Or in a cafe?

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: The old school building is nostalgic, but a cafe is more convenient. I can reserve a cafe in the center.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Do that! We also need to find everyone's addresses. I still have an old list. I'll write to everyone.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Perfect! I'll do the cafe and you do the invitations. And everyone pays for their own food, that's simpler.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Absolutely! Then we'll divide the tasks like that.

phrases.response: Only the students from the class.

phrases.german: We need to find the addresses.
phrases.response: I still have an old list.

phrases.german: Then we'll divide the tasks like that.

scenarios.title: Visit for a Guest
scenarios.scenario: A friend from abroad is coming to visit, and you are planning their stay.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Tina, our friend Marco is coming next weekend! We need to plan his stay.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: True! When is he arriving? I can pick him up from the airport.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: That's nice of you. He lands on Friday at 3:00 PM. Where should he stay overnight? I have space at my place.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Good, then he'll stay with you. What do we want to show him? He likes art and history.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Then we'll visit the Historical Museum on Saturday and do a city tour. I'll buy the tickets.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Great! And in the evening we'll go to my favorite restaurant. I'll reserve a table for the three of us.

dialogue.speaker: B
dialogue.line: Perfect. Then I'll pick him up, you make the reservation, and I'll take care of the tickets for the museum.

dialogue.speaker: A
dialogue.line: Wonderful! I'm really looking forward to his visit!

phrases.german: What do we want to show him?
